column1: MT197433,Contract,"London Borough of Barnet Council",Awarded,2017-05-11T17:45:17Z,"Accommodation and Support for Adults","Accommodation and Support Services for Adults consisting of 8 lots as follows:Lot 1 - Support at HomeLot 2 - Neighbourhood NetworksLot 3 - Supported Living (Low / Medium / High)Lot 4 - Supported Living for Young Adults transitionLot 5 - Specialist Mental Health Step DownLot 6 - Supported living for people with complex disabilities and health needsLot 7 - Crash Pad for People with Learning Disabilities and / or AutismLot 8 - Sheltered PlusPlease register on our E-Portal to receive tender documentation.www.barnetsourcing.co.uk",,,"North East","85000000 ",,stacey.sangha@barnet.gov.uk,"North London Business Park",,London,N111NP,England,"+44 2083597641",www.barnetsourcing.co.uk,,"http://www.mytenders.org/search/show/search_view.aspx?ID=MAY142552 ",,01/04/2017,31/03/2021,28/10/2016,NO,,No,No,No,Services,200000,,31/03/2017,200000,"[Creative Support Ltd

TD1228 - DN259638 (2),Contract,"Derby City Council",Awarded,2018-01-05T14:38:28Z,"Provision of Younger Adults Domiciliary Care Services Framework","In line with good practice and national directives, Local Authorities aim to reduce the demand for institutional care by increasing options for community support by commissioning or providing services which promote and support independence.

Derby City Council is therefore tendering for a Younger Adults Domiciliary Care Services framework for people with complex needs to be delivered in their own homes from November 2017 This will replace an existing Dynamic Purchasing Service Agreement.

The Framework will provide support for younger adults with complex needs, those with a learning disability and / or autism, and with mental health difficulties.  Many will have, at times, behaviours that are considered to be ""challenging"", and providers will be required to demonstrate how they can minimise its impact by developing positive work with individuals.

The Council wishes to commission services that improve Customers' wellbeing or quality of life where the quality of the service is measured by the improvement in quality of life outcomes.  An enablement approach lies at the heart of the services we wish to procure for Domiciliary Care and providers will be assessed for their success in this area.

This outcomes based approach will necessitate a change in the relationship between Customers, Providers and Commissioners as it requires a greater focus upon person-centred working and the adoption of outcomes based purchasing, provision and monitoring of services.
Outcome based service provision requires the following:

•	Each Customer will have their personal Customer Outcomes which are to be met by the service agreed.  The views of their carer or representative if appropriate will be taken into consideration and will form part of this Agreement.
•	The Authority will then specify the Customer Outcomes to be met by The Service Provider
•	The Service Provider, in consultation with social care leads, will agree with each Customer how and when they will be supported to achieve their Outcomes.

Please note suppliers wishing to express interest and obtain the documentation must do so by 17:00 on 24th September 2017. It is recommended that you express interest and obtain the documentation well before this time to allow sufficient time to prepare and submit a bid.
The deadline for returns is 10:00 on 25th September 2017.
Please visit the Council's e-tendering system at www.eastmidstenders.org, where you can express interest and obtain the documents.

Please note: we will only accept expressions of interest through the e-tendering system.",,,"East Midlands","85000000 ","Paul Hallsworth",procurement@derby.gov.uk,"The Council House","Corporation Street",Derby,"DE1 2FS",England,"01332 640768",www.eastmidstenders.org,,,"Please visit www.eastmidstenders.org to access the documentation for this tender.",15/11/2017,14/11/2018,25/09/2017,YES,"TD1228 - DN259638",Yes,No,No,Services,2800000,5600000,28/11/2017,5600000,"[CREATIVE SUPPORT LTD

column1: 229,Contract,"Wigan Council",Awarded,2019-05-15T16:37:06Z,"WELLBEING AND RESILIENCE SERVICES","Lot 1:  A community resilience and wellbeing recovery service that offers support for people with generic, complex and offending behaviour.

The resilience and wellbeing recovery service will build on existing support services and provide short term outcome focussed, floating support to vulnerable adults aged over 16.  It will build capital, improve health, ensure stability of accommodation and support meaningful and economic activity.  Outcomes for services users will be sustainable and will limit the number of repeat presentations to floating support services and improve independence.

Lot 2:  Floating support specifically focussing on supporting people with mental health needs and adults with a diagnosis of autism or those who are yet to be diagnosed who are need of support for mental health/autism

As with the floating support service lot 2 will build on existing services and provide short term outcome focussed interventions to vulnerable adults aged over 18.    The service will transform people's lives by providing ethical, asset based support for people who are living in their own homes who have mental health needs/autism.  Lot 2 will focus on prevention with the core element of service delivery aimed at keeping people well.",,,"North West","85000000 98000000 ","Mark Holden",m.holden@wigan.gov.uk,"Town Hall.","P.O. Box 100",WIGAN,WN11NJ,England,"01942 486 260",,,"www.the-chest.org.uk ",,01/07/2019,30/06/2024,18/01/2019,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,2134815,,14/05/2019,2134815,"[Creative Support Ltd.

column1: MT156831,Contract,"West Berkshire Council",Awarded,2015-07-01T13:43:20Z,"Supported Living Schemes and Floating Support for Adults With Learning Disabilities","This is a Contract Award Notice. This service will deliver low to high intensity non-accommodation based care and housing related support and will meet the individually assessed needs of the people who will receive the service, as reflected through their outcome based person-centred support plans, and in line with the expectations of the ""Community Services Directorate Plan"" and the ""Valuing People"" White Paper.

This service will also deliver low to medium accommodation based housing related care and support and will meet the individually assessed needs of the people who will receive the service, as reflected through their person-centred support plans, and in line with the expectations of ""Local Services for Local People"" and the ""Valuing People Now"" White Paper.

The service will deliver the specification within the geographical boundaries of West Berkshire District Council",,,"South East","85000000 ","Contracts & Procurement Officer",msullivan@westberks.gov.uk,"Council Offices","Market Street",Newbury,"RG14 5LD",England,"+44 1635519415",http://www.westberks.gov.uk,,"http://www.mytenders.org/search/show/search_view.aspx?ID=JUN110890 ",,01/06/2015,31/05/2018,10/02/2015,NO,,Yes,No,No,Services,2243595,,21/05/2015,2243595,"[Creative Support Ltd

column1: S6052,Contract,"South Tyneside Council",Awarded,2019-05-13T08:57:52Z,"Independent Supported Living for Adults with a Learning Disability and/or Autism (Jarrow Scheme)","The service to be delivered is independent supported living service for 8 people with a learning disability and / or autism who need support / advice and direct intervention, including personal care.",,,"North East","85000000 ","Karen Dixon",karen.dixon@southtyneside.gov.uk,"Town Hall, Westoe Road",,"South Shields",NE332RL,England,"07585 966533",,,"https://procontract.due-north.com/Login ","Tender documents via https://www.nepo.org/suppliers/opportunities or https://procontract.due-north.com/Login. You will need to register as a supplier to access the documents. Once you are logged onto the system, click ""current opportunities"" and under the organisations filter click on South Tyneside Council, then click on update at the bottom of the screen. This will direct you to South Tyneside Council current opportunities. You will then be required to register your interest in this tender. Once registered, all questions should be addressed via the messages facility on the NEPO portal.

If you need guidance on how to register or submit your response through the NEPO Portal, please visit the NEPO website training section at https://www.nepo.org/suppliers/learn to access the Navigating the Portal suite of videos. These also include useful information on how to manage your online Procontract account.
Tenderers requiring assistance on registering or submitting their tender should contact the Procontract Portal Administration Team:

Proactis Supplier Support Helpdesk Ticketing System (http://proactis.kayako.com) - To be used by Tenderers to raise issues directly onto the ticketing system for non-time critical issues i.e. password resets / account queries, finding information, etc. or email (ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com ) and a ticket will be raised on the Tenderers behalf.",02/09/2019,31/08/2024,07/01/2019,YES,S6052,Yes,No,No,Services,4500000,,10/05/2019,4066035,"[Creative Support Ltd

RBC 00000199 - AWARD,Contract,"Reading Borough Council",Awarded,2017-02-20T16:30:55Z,"Extra Care Housing Care Services - AWARD","Reading Borough Council invite Tenders to provide care within six Extra Care schemes for older people in the Borough.  The Council's focus is on promotion of independence and to prevent, reduce or delay the need for support. We want people to build, recover and retain skills to be able to live as full a life as possible.  Our Extra Care schemes will act as hubs within the community for older and vulnerable people to access care and social activities.
      The council currently commissions 1198.5 hours of care within four Extra Care schemes and this is projected to increase as clients with more complex needs are placed there and two new schemes open.  Currently the council spends approximately £993,000 per year on home care within these Extra Care sheltered housing schemes.    
      
      The Schemes Covered By This Contract
      
      Oak Tree House - 10 Spey Road, Tilehurst, Reading, RG30 4DZ
      
      60 housing units with an onsite restaurant, activity rooms including a hairdresser and an assisted bathroom.    Building owned and managed by Catalyst Housing Association. Currently 291.5 hours of personal care are delivered by the current care provider, this includes night care and floating support, there are staff employed by the current care provider who will have transfer rights under TUPE.  An office will be provided for the care provider, and there is currently no charge for this office.   
       
      Cedar Court - 30 Whitley Rise, Basingstoke Road, Reading, RG2 ONS
      
      40 housing units with an onsite restaurant, activity room, assisted bathroom, guest flat hairdresser and therapy suite and hobby room.  Building owned and managed by Reading Borough Council. 343.5 hours of care are delivered by the current care provider including night and floating support, there are staff employed by the current care provider who will have transfer rights under TUPE.  An office will be provided for the care provider, and there is currently no charge for this office.
      
      Chimney Court - Shilling Close, Tilehurst, Reading, RG30 4EN
      
      There are 56 housing units with an onsite restaurant and social activity spaces including guest flat, assisted bathing facility, garden and hobby room.  Building owned and managed by A2D.  There are 286.5 hours of care currently provided by the current care provider and there are staff employed by the current care provider who will have transfer rights under TUPE.  There will be an office provided for the care provider and the rental for this is currently set at £7,977.32 per annum,  inclusive of service charge.
      
      Cornerstones - Halcyon Terrace, Tilehurst, Reading, RG30 4XR
      
      There are 41 housing units with an onsite restaurant and social activity spaces including guest flat, assisted bathing facility, garden and hobby room.  Building owned and managed by A2D.  There are 277 hours of care currently provided by the current care provider and there are staff employed by the current care provider who will have transfer rights ...",,"RG1 2LU","Any region","85312000 85000000 ","John Littlefair",john.littlefair@reading.gov.uk,"Bridge Street",Reading,Berkshire,"RG1 2LU","United Kingdom","0118 9372568",,,,,26/03/2017,31/08/2022,16/11/2016,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,13000000,15000000,29/12/2017,0,"[Creative Support Ltd

column1: MT186309,Contract,"Halton Borough Council",Awarded,2016-10-19T16:45:04Z,"Tender for the Provision of Housing Related Support Services for Brennan Lodge, Widnes","The Authority is seeking to commission a suitably experienced organisation to provide housing related support for single homeless persons in a new supported housing scheme at Brennan Lodge, Albert Rd, Widnes.In recent years the Authority has been rationalising its homeless accommodation services to ensure they remain fit for purpose, and seeking to equalise provision between the two towns of Widnes and Runcorn. This development is a key step to achieving this.Brennan Lodge consists of 36 self-contained apartments and 3 direct access units built over two floors with associated communal and office facilities. One of the direct access units will be used primarily by young people referred by the Authority's Social Services Young People's Team.The building is owned by Halton Housing Trust, the successful tenderer will need to agree to provide housing management services via a separate but coterminous agreement.",,,"North West","85311000 ",,procurement@halton.gov.uk,"Kingsway House c/o Municipal Building, Kingsway",,Widnes,"WA8 7QF","

Reference CIN0096,Contract,"North Tyneside Council",Awarded,2018-01-02T15:15:13Z,"Award of Mental Healh Block Gross contract extension","AWARD ONLY

This is a short term extension to an existing block gross contract. The service has been in the process of negotiating a move in premises from Marine Avenue to an existing service at Knavesmere House. As part of this planned move the provider has handed back the lease of the property at Marine Avenue back to the Council. The provider handed the lease back to the Council on the 31st of May 2017. The block gross contract ended on the same day to be replaced by an ISA (Individual Service Agreement) which will present a significant saving to relevant budgets. Similar services have already moved from block gross contract arrangement to ISA but this service was unable to do so until the issues around the lease were resolved.",,,"North East","85100000 ",,Christine.Bordoli@northtyneside.gov.uk,Quadrant,"Cobalt Business Park, Silverlink North","North Tyneside","NE27 0BY",England,,,,,,01/01/2017,31/05/2017,20/12/2016,NO,,No,No,No,Services,227915,,20/12/2016,227915,"[CREATIVE SUPPORT LTD

SCHG00164.,Contract,"Staffordshire County Council",Awarded,2017-10-12T10:50:34Z,"Personalised Support and Care Framework","Staffordshire County Council would like to invite Suppliers who are committed to providing high quality Personalised Support and Care services, that promote independence and lead to an improved quality of life that enables Service Users to be able to remain in their own home for as long as possible and to achieve and maintain their autonomy, independence, personal identity and assessed outcomes.

The Suppliers shall provide the services for the benefits of all adults who reside in the County of Staffordshire(excluding Stoke on Trent) and who are also aged eighteen (18) years or over (except for those going through transition from Children's to Adults) and who have been assessed by the Council or their partners as eligible to receive support and care within their own home. Care will be delivered within the Service User's own home or ordinary place of residence within the County of Staffordshire (excluding the City of Stoke-on-Trent). Service Users and Carers are to remain at the centre of decisions about their care, thus ensuring care is provided in a person centred way. The Council will be appointing multiple suppliers to provide various call off contracts under a framework agreement for personalised support and care services across 12 (twelve) geographical Contract Zones within Staffordshire under the following
Lot 1: Generic Framework Provider of Personalised Support and Care;
Lot 2: Capacity Block Provider of Personalised Support and Care;
Lot 3: Pre-Purchased Rota Provider of Personalised Support and Care;
Lot 4: 'Future' Capacity Blocks of Personalised Support and Care;
Within Health and Social care, Service Users can have a range of needs, which may broadly fit into one or more of the following service categories (but not restricted to):

The Provider must have an understanding of the needs of the service categories; ensure that they are able to provide these services and to employ a workforce that is appropriately skilled, experienced and diverse in order to meet the assessed needs. There are some enhanced requirements detailed within the service specification for services users when the service is provided within an Extra Care Housing Scheme.",,,"West Midlands","85300000 ","Clare Kinvig-Jenkinson",clare.kinvig-jenkinson@staffordshire.gov.uk,"2 Staffordshire Place, Tipping Street",,Stafford,"ST16 2DH",England,"01785 864056",,,,"The Council have not Awarded LOT 5.",01/10/2017,31/08/2021,20/06/2017,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,35344800,,15/09/2017,35344800,"[5 Care Services

column1: LEICSCITY02-DN434602-92573834,Contract,"Leicester City Council",Awarded,2020-07-24T11:19:57Z,"ASC0257 - Supported Living Services","Leicester City Council ('the 'Authority') invited tenders for the provision of Supported Living Services ('the Services'). The procurement for these services have now concluded and the contracts have now been awarded. The Authority conducted this procurement under the light touch regime for social and other specific services, as set out in the Public Contract Regulations 2015, at Section 7 (Regulations 74 to 77) and Schedule 3. The procurement process was not conducted under the Public Contract Regulations 2015; however, it was similar to that of an open procedure. The process, unlike an open procedure, included the flexibility, as allowed under the light touch regime with various evaluation stages as detailed in the Invitation to Tender documentation. Lot 1: Enablement Supported Living Services for people with Learning Disability and Mental Health. Lot 2: Living Well Supported Living Services for older people and people living with dementia. Lot 3: Living Well Supported Living Services for people with a physical and sensory disability. Lot 4: Specialist Supported Living Services for people with Complex Needs. Lot 5: Recovery Supported Living Services for people with Complex Adult Mental Health. For Lot 1, Lot 2, Lot 3, and Lot 4 Framework Agreements are awarded. For Lot 5 a Block Contract has been awarded. Lot 1, Lot 2, Lot 3, and Lot 5, the initial term means the period commencing on 1 July 2021 up to and including 2 November 2025. Potential Extension Period(s) 2 further periods of up to no more than 24 months in total subject to the Maximum Term. Maximum Term means the period commencing on 1 July 2021 up to and including 31 October 2027. For Lot 4, the initial term means the period commencing on 2 November 2020 up to and including 2 November 2025. Potential Extension Period(s) 2 further periods of up to no more than 24 months in total subject to the Maximum Term. Maximum Term means the period commencing on 2 November 2020 up to and including 31 October 2027.",,,"East Midlands","85000000 98000000 ","Yatish Shah",procurement-asc@leicester.gov.uk,"City Hall","115 Charles Street",Leicester,"LE1 1FZ","United Kingdom","+44 1164542348",http://www.leicester.gov.uk,,,"

Note this is a Contract Award Notice. Contracts for these services have now been awarded.",02/11/2020,31/10/2027,11/12/2019,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,140010000,140010000,13/07/2020,140010000,"[Advance Housing and Support Ltd

column1: Awarded - RFQ 13772310,1/2,Contract,"Lancashire County Council",Awarded,2017-02-15T11:36:56Z,"Flexible Agreement for Learning Disability Supported Living Services - Transforming Care - PAN Lancashire","In line with the national Transforming Care Agenda Lancashire County Council (LCC) has been working closely in partnership with the Lancashire Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) and Blackpool, and Blackburn with Darwen local authorities, to consider the provision required for people with learning disabilities and/or autism who display behaviour that challenges, including those with a mental health condition  and require a placement in the community following an in-patient stay or to prevent an in-patient admission.

Due to the estimated discharges in the next 12 months within the Pan-Lancashire area, a Flexible Agreement has been developed. This is intended to be an interim agreement and will initially be in place for one year with the option to extend for up to a further three years if required.  This is to allow the time to develop further commissioning options for Transforming Care whilst allowing us to have an initial agreement in operation as early as October 2016, to allow Transforming Care placements to be commissioned with suitably selected providers via this Flexible Agreement.
Social value has been considered throughout the development of the service specification and is part of the evaluation methodology.
Please note that the original RFQ in relation to this tender has been amended due to a revision to the selection criteria in relation to CQC ratings.

LCC requires a Provider to be registered with CQC for the regulated activity of Personal Care by the tender deadline of the 12th August 2016 however if a Provider nominates an office that is currently unrated as it has not yet been inspected by CQC then your Submission will not be disregarded on that basis, however at the point when the office has its first inspection you must inform the lead officer immediately and your nominated office must meet the requirements of either outstanding, good or requires improvement (latter with robust justification). Prior to contract award where the status of your nominated office does not meet the requirements for the Flexible Agreement your Submission will be disregarded. Following contract award if any provider is given an overall rating of requires improvement or inadequate for the nominated office the Contracting Body reserves the right to suspend/terminate the agreement depending on its own judgement.

The RFQ on the e-tendering system has been amended to reflect this along with all the tender documents. The tender deadline will be extended to the 12/08/16 to allow providers sufficient time to consider submitting a bid having taken into account the revised criteria.",,,"North West","85000000 ","Joanne Sherborne",joanne.sherborne@lancashire.gov.uk,"2nd Floor, Christ Church Precinct","County Hall",Preston,"PR1 8XJ",England,"01772 531427",,,"http://www3.lancashire.gov.uk/corporate/web/?siteid=6864&pageid=41137&e=e ","Please Note:  Value of Contract

The Total Contract Value is expected to be between £20m and £150m. ",28/10/2016,27/10/2020,12/08/2016,YES,"RFQ 13772310,1",Yes,Yes,No,Services,20000000,,28/10/2016,150000000,"[Access Community Services Ltd

column1: 9RXL-PL46A2-AB7B-VJGXWC,Contract,"Bradford Metropolitan District Council",Awarded,2016-06-23T09:32:36Z,"Supported Living Framework","Supported Housing is focussed in the support that enables individuals to maintain their own tenancy, promoteindependent living and move on; usually people who live in supported housing have their support needs met by'housing related support'. Supported Living is more likely to be longer term help and support to enable a person to live as independentlyas possible. The Framework will be split into following lots as follows:- Lot 1: Homelessness Services Lot 2: Multiple Needs Lot 3: Young People at Risk Lot 4: Learning Disabilities Lot 4a: Learning Disabilities Complex Needs Lot 5: Mental Health Lot 5a: Mental Health Complex Needs Lot 6: Physical and Sensory Needs The framework will run for an initial 3 (three) years with an the sole discretion of the Council,to extend for a further 1 year, subject to satisfactory contract performance and the Council having the need for aprovider framework and the funding available for the framework. All values and figures quoted.",,"BD1 5RW","Yorkshire and the Humber","85300000 85310000 85320000 85000000 ","Saima Iqbal",saima.iqbal@bradford.gov.uk,"Adult & Community Services","North Wing, 6th Floor, Jacobs Well, Nelson Street,",Bradford,"BD1 5RW",UK,"01274 437999",,,,,27/07/2015,14/06/2018,09/03/2015,NO,,Yes,Yes,No,Services,120000000,120000000,27/08/2015,120000000,"[Impact Property Services

column1: 20200503143259-68205,Contract,"NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit",Awarded,2020-05-03T14:33:14Z,"An NHS Continuing Healthcare Domiciliary Care Service in Derbyshire - Window 2","The Service covers Home Care (Domiciliary Care) in Derbyshire and will be provided for people (Service Users) who have been determined by the Commissioner as having an NHS-funded continuing care entitlement.
The Provider will ensure that the services can be provided 365 days per year, 24 hours a day and in accordance with a Service User's Care Plan.

Any Qualified Provider (AQP) contracts are awarded on a zero value, zero volume basis and the contract awarded will be for a period of18 months with the option to extend for 2 years, subject to satisfactory performance.

The standard package per hour is £15.94 EXCLUDING additional travel rate. Please access Schedule 3 (Payment) of ""Document 4 Contract Particulars.doc"" for full information including complex, sleep in, live in and travel rates.
